{{Multiple issues| {{COI|date=June 2017}} {{advert|date=June 2017}} }} {{Infobox person | name = Xtian Dela | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Aurther Mandela | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|2|18|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Ngara]], [[Nairobi]], [[Kenya]] | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = | nationality = [[Kenyan]] | other_names = Xtian Dela | occupation = {{hlist|[[Blogger]]|[[YouTuber]]|Radio Presenter}} | years_active = 2007 - Present | known_for = ''Full Throttle'' on [[NRG Radio Kenya]] | notable_works = Head of Social and Digital Media at [[Jeff Koinange Live|Jeff Koinange LIVE]] on [[Citizen TV]] }}
'''Aurther Mandela''' (born 18 February 1990), better known as '''Xtian Dela''', is a Kenyan YouTuber,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/c/xtiandela|title=Xtian Dela TV|website=YouTube|access-date=2016-06-27}}</ref> blogger, [[Internet celebrity|social media personality]] and a [[radio]] presenter. In 2014, he won the Best Personal [[Blog]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://memeburn.com/2014/05/25-of-the-best-bloggers-operating-in-africa-today/|title=25 of the best bloggers operating in Africa today|date=2014-05-09|website=Memeburn|access-date=2016-06-27}}</ref> in the African Bloggers Awards<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.africanbloggerawards.com/|title=African Blogger Awards - African Blogger Awards - Hosted by South Africans|website=African Blogger Awards|language=English|access-date=2016-06-27}}</ref> and the Most Influential Twitter Personality<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bloggers.or.ke/2014/10/04/olx-social-media-awards-2014-winners/|title=OLX Social Media Awards 2014 winners|last=Akaki|first=Lulu|date=2014-10-04|website=BAKE Blog|access-date=2016-06-27}}</ref> in the Kenyan Social Media Awards.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://soma.or.ke/2014-nominees/|title=2014 Nominees {{!}} Social Media Awards|last=Gitau|first=Joseph|website=soma.or.ke|access-date=2016-06-27}}</ref> In the same year, he was nominated at the Africa Social Media Award<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://awards.smafrica.com/|title=Home - Social Media Awards Africa|website=Social Media Awards Africa|language=English|access-date=2016-06-27}}</ref> for the Social Media Hero in Africa, Twitter Handle of the Year in Africa and Influencer of the Year in Africa<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://informereastafrica.com/node/573|title=HERE THEY ARE: 2014 SOCIAL MEDIA AWARDS AFRICA FINALISTS ANNOUNCE |access-date=2016-06-27 |website=Informer East Africa}}</ref> Awards. Still in 2014, he started an initiative on Twitter called #BringBackOurKDFSolders<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/hashtag/BringBackOurKDFSoldiers?src=hash|title=#BringBackOurKDFSoldiers hashtag on Twitter|website=twitter.com|access-date=2016-06-27}}</ref> to force the [[Government of Kenya]] to bring back the Kenya Defence Force (KDF) who had been deployed in [[Somalia]] at that time to combat the Al-Shabab. The initiative was picked up by [[BBC]] who did a story about it.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/blogs-trending-27907501|title=#BBCtrending: Should Kenya bring back its boys? - BBC News|language=English|access-date=2016-06-27}}</ref>
In 2015 he won the award of The Best Twitter Personality in Africa<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.southafrica.info/about/media/african-bloggers-070515.htm#.V3Fdcbh977A|title=Africa's bloggers set own agenda|website=www.southafrica.info|access-date=2016-06-27}}</ref> in the African Bloggers Awards. In August the same year, he won Kenyan Corporate Social Media Personality of the Year Award at the [[Jumia]] Kenya Glamour Awards.<ref name="jumia kenya glamour 2015">{{Cite web|url=https://www.jumia.co.ke/blog/jumia-kenya-glamour-awards-full-list-of-winners/|title=Jumia Kenya Glamour Awards: Full List of Winners | work=Jumia |date=12 August 2015|language=English|access-date=19 July 2016}}</ref> In the same year he also won the Kenyan Twitter Personality of the Year in the KenyaBuzz People's Choice Awards.<ref name="kenyabuzz 2015">{{Cite web|url=https://www.kenyabuzz.com/lifestyle/the-kenyabuzz-peoples-choice-awards-2015-winners|title=Unveiled! The KenyaBuzz People’s Choice Awards 2015 Winners|website=KenyaBuzz|access-date=19 July 2016 | date=23 November 2015}}</ref> He joined Nation FM (formerly known as [[Easy FM (Kenya)|Easy FM]]) in September 2015 as a [[radio presenter]] hosting the popular Saturday morning show ''#TheDetox'' alongside Deejay Xclusive. In September 2015, he joined ''[[Jeff Koinange Live]]'' on [[Kenya Television Network|KTN Kenya]] as the Head of Social and Digital Media.
In 2016 he won the award of the Best [[Facebook]] Profile in [[Africa]]<ref name="african blogger 2016">{{Cite web|url=http://www.africanbloggerawards.com/2016-winners/|title=2016 Winners | publisher=African Blogger Awards|language=English|access-date=2016-07-18}}</ref> and the Second Most Influential Twitter Personality in Africa in the Africa Bloggers Awards.The 2016 African Bloggers Awards were sponsored by the [[Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation]]. In 2016 He also became one of [[Viber]]'s African partners.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thetimesofafrica.com/viber-spreads-good-vibes-africa-introduction-public-chats|title=Viber Spreads Good Vibes in Africa with the Introduction of Public Chats {{!}} The Times of Africa|website=www.thetimesofafrica.com|access-date=2016-06-27}}</ref>
In 2017 he partnered with [[FC Barcelona]] and [[Beko]] in the #Time2Play<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.fcbarcelona.com/bekotime2play-|title=#Time2Play Competition has ended {{!}} FC Barcelona|website=FC Barcelona|language=English|access-date=2017-06-28}}</ref> Experience campaign that saw 22 winners<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.beko.com/FC-Barcelona-Sponsorship/|title=BEKO|website=www.beko.com|language=English|access-date=2017-06-28}}</ref> from across 22 Countries across the world fly to [[Camp Nou]] in Barcelona, Spain to have the FC Barcelona Experience.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/search?q=#Time2Play&src=typd|title=Twitter Search|website=twitter.com|language=en|access-date=2017-06-28}}</ref> He was the only Influencer chosen in Africa to take part.
On 19 May 2018, he joined [https://nrg.radio/ NRG Radio Kenya] as a presenter, hosting the popular Hip Hop Show Full Throttle, alongside Grammy Award winning Radio Personality [[Fatman Scoop]] and DJ Mr Vince.
In 2018, he was named among the Top 100 Most Influential Young Africans on the Continent by [http://www.africayouthawards.org/2018-100-most-influential-young-africans-announced/ Africa Youth Awards], The biggest African youth awards scheme which recognises the achievements of young Africans, young change makers on the continent and beyond. Notable among the 2018 honorees are Uganda’s Robert Kyagulanyi Ssentamu (Bobi Wine), Togo’s Farida Bemba Nabourema, Egypt’s Mohamed Salah, Nigeria’s Davido, Guinea’s ABD Traore, South Africa’s Cassper Nyovest and Tanzania’s Alikiba.
== Early life == Xtian Dela was born on 18 February 1990 in Ngara, [[Nairobi]]. Xtian went to Likii Hii School for his primary school education and Moi High School Kabarak for his secondary education. He then joined the [[University of Nairobi]], School of Business in 2009.
